topic.title: /r/collapse
topic.body: Alternative location for the /r/collapse Reddit community

1_1AbPJSk8hULMMSzFhidAu72itdHmTfjSrD.body:
TAP TAP TAP
Is this thing on?

> [goocy](#comment_1_114kU48efyoXi5ExjrE14aT4q62jNErRL7): Seems to work!
> Now this is just a thread on the example ZeroTalk thread, so I'd like to set up an own ZeroTalk page.

Allright, I'll look into that myself. But I really recommend you look at PC Engines https://www.amazon.de/PC-Engines-APU2C4-Komplett-Alu-Geh%C3%A4use/dp/B01GEIEI7M/ with a larger mSATA SSD than the 16 GB that kit ships with instead of a Raspie.

> [up4](#comment_74_1BLPKyrF2D4ertte6JnAa6oWAMYzZGwKQz): I don't know man, you started it. Maybe it's because here, the collapse is a given fact not worth discussing. Interestingly in the last DNS DDoS attack, the dark web, including ZeroNet was the only internet still up for meâ€¦

Higher availability due to decentralization is definitely a major plus. Projects like cjdns and ZeroNet, Tahoe LAFS do really look like they will be around for a long while.

1_13EUVTHXUNK46bs3QXB8AtJ6sxPXcSQh31.body: You can use an exchange or use localbitcoins to get it for cash.

8_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body: Hey nofish, thanks for making ZeroNet. It is really quite useful already in this early stage.
